intro: Paranomus lagopus, commonly known as the snowdrop, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It is characterized by its distinctive nodding flowers that bloom in early spring, often before the leaves appear. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and has narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowers are usually white or greenish-white, with three petals and three sepals. Paranomus lagopus thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas or along streambanks.
